Reviews.Title: “wow. Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: KateLancasterRipon
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here with friends last week, 18th April 2012. We all agreed the hotel was exceptional in every way. Its a brill location to explore this magnificent place. Easy, interesting walk to the places we wanted to visit. The staff are totally welcoming and friendly. We loved the food and the roof top restaurant views were breath taking. Room cleaned daily and more than adequate for resting after a day exploring. I would totally recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Well done, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming view from the roof-top restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JayAshin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in this hotel for leisure during Easter. To be honest, the hotel is quite small and the location is not perfect. From the airport we have to take the airport bus to Taksim, then the funicular to Kabatas and then change the tram to Karakoy. But the hotel is just about 10-min walk from the tram station which we found it acceptable. We received a warm welcome and a complimentary cold drink when we were checking-in at the reception. The nice bellboy helped us to carry our baggages to our room and patiently introduced the facilities inside, as well as the tourist attractions nearby. The room was not spacious but very clean, and we were lucky to have a seaview room! We did not have our lunch yet when we arrived so we headed to the roof-top restaurant. The view there is so amazing that you would just want to sit there for the whole day facing the other side of Istanbul. The food and drinks served there are also not pricey, even cheaper than some of the restaurants in Sultanahmet. We went there again the same night after sightseeing and enjoyed the night view so much. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff from start to finish!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexia1978
Reviews.Content: Going to a new Country with new cultures can be intimidating all by itselfâ€¦ This was going to be the vacation of the start of our life together and we carefully selected the hotel. This was based off price, location, and amenities. What more can you look for when you know very little about a new place? My fiancÃ©s friend had stayed at The Golden City Hotel once and he told us that it was a great hotel that he could relax in peace at the end of each busy day. I have to say that this was a large influence in our decision. My fiancÃ© and I definitely agreed that we will stay there again if/when we go back to Turkey! I would definitely recommend The Golden City Hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in Istanbul. First of all, the check in process was quick and seamless and all of the staff members were very professional, helpful and friendly! We were escorted up to our room by a very friendly bell boy (who carried our luggage with a smile). After we reserved the room through a travel agency, my fiancÃ© contacted the hotel directly and asked for the largest bed that they have and we arrived to our room to find the largest bed (vs. a French bed). Our single request had already been taken care of prior to our arrival. We had traveled all day and we were hungry but didnâ€™t want to go out. This hotel has a fabulous restaurant on the 10th floor. It also has an amazing view of the sea and the city. After we got settled into our room, we decided to try this restaurant. The food was so flavorful and delicious!! Itâ€™s not a little snack restaurant. You can order real food like steak. They also have a full bar if you want a drink. It was clear that the chiefs take pride in the meals they prepare! The food was very tasty and it offered perfect portions. The sauce was incredible and the steak was tender, high quality and cooked perfectly. I asked for a drink with dinner and that, too, was perfect. The dinner was a very pleasing way to end the day of travel. And when we were done, we only needed to take the elevator and we were â€˜homeâ€™. We slept like babies. We never heard any sounds through the walls in this hotel. There was also a small safe in our room in which we were able to keep things like our original passports and extra money. In the morning we went back up to the restaurant on the 10th floor and ate our complimentary breakfast. They had a variety of meats, cheeses, fresh fruit and vegetables, cereal, fresh coffee and tea, yogurt, Danishes, olives, boiled eggs and fresh bread loaves with a toaster. Needless to say, we went up there for breakfast each morning. I have to add that the restaurant staff kept a close eye on the food to ensure that nothing ran out prior to the breakfast end time of 10:30am. Of course, you do not spend the majority of your time in your hotel room when you are on a vacation. We were out all day and most of the night. But when we returned to the hotel, we were always greeted with friendly smiles and everyone ensured we had everything we needed. They even recommended places we should visit and handed us the fliers. Mr. Ali (the manager) even called and booked one of tours to the Princeâ€™s Island. He was able to communicate in the native Turkish language and he ensured that we got the best rate. He also recommended a Turkish Night Tour, which turned out to be so much fun! My daughter became ill in America and Mr. Ali was also ever so kind to fax the consent form for me from the hotel to my sister in America, so she could take my daughter to the doctor. He consistently provided more than 100% customer service. The Golden City Hotel is located within walking distance to the Galata Tower and Istkalal Street (this street is the pathway to Taksim Square.) Our sincere gratitude goes out to all of the staff at this hotel! Everyone was so friendly and professional. This includes all the bell boys, restaurant staff, housekeeping, Ms. Durdane at the front desk and the hotel manager, Mr. Ali! It was extremely pleasing to be greeted in this new Country by such wonderful hospitality! We really cannot say enough positive things to express our gratitude! PS: Ms. Durdane also called a legitimate taxi to pick us up from our hotel and take us to the Istanbul airport for our departure. (When in Turkey, you will realize that a legitimate taxi with a meter is not the norm.) Thank you so much for making our hotel feel more like a home. Weâ€™ll see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “View from rooftop Restaurant is the only good thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCWorldTraveler1963
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the hardware section of Istanbul with very little around it. It is not far from Galata Bridge but beyond that, it has nothing to offer. I did like the view from the restaurant and the breakfast food was decent, however the rooms were small and you were literally at the bottom of a huge hill. It is better to stay at the Taksim area hotels where the people are. Also, if you room is facing the street, be prepared for LOTS OF NOISE. The staff was great and very nice. This is an average Super 8 type of motel in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “For sure we will go back”
Reviews.Author: Athena F
Reviews.Content: We have been in Istanbul for a week. It was just great!! The Golden city hotel was perfect. The best location, all that you have to visit are just a breath from the hotel. We had not any broblem with our reservation. The rooms was really nice and comfortable, modern design and cozy, clean and very good cview. The staff was really really helpfull, friendly and kind. Special thanks to reception team Ali, Duygu, Tuna, Candar, Bellboy Hurcan and from the restaurant special thanks to Samet, also to our good friend Gokhan. All of them did the best they could to make our staying better and our vacations unforgetable. Next time we will visit Istanbul we wiil definitely stay on GOLDEN CITY ISTANBUL HOTEL again. Cok guzel zaman gecirdik...!! Cok tesekkur ederim!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alaquiao
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here and were very pleased with our stay. We contacted the hotel before our arrival and they arranged transfers from Ataturk airport. Our driver was waiting for us despite our flight arriving late and the additional delay of a missing bag. Check in was straightforward and easy and the staff were very helpful. The lifts are the smallest I have ever been in - it takes 4 people but is a tight squash with 2! The only problem we had during our stay was with a noisy group of kids laughing, yelling and banging doors long into the night. We complained to reception and they sent someone up to quiet the kids, worked for a few minutes, then started up again so we phoned reception again. They spoke to their teachers in the morning and the kids were a lot quieter the following night. Shame about the noisy traffic and the barking dogs though. Breakfasts got a bit boring but the views from the rooftop restaurant were stunning by day and by night. I had no problem with the location, yes there are a lot of hardware stores and the streets are quite hard to navigate with all the stock piled outside but it is a short walk across Galata Bridge to old Istanbul or to the Tunel funicular railway up to Taksim and the shops of modern Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staying - GR Comenius team”
Reviews.Author: ComeniusGRteam
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is quite convenient. For all the major sights of the city although the surroundings were far from attractive (a neglected side yard, plenty of hardware shops and a very busy street in front of the hotel). The rooms were comfortable and spacious and our breakfast rich and tasty. The hotel employees were forthcoming and friendly. Special thanks to Ali in the reception for being so helpful and pleasant. What we enjoyed the most was the fantastic view of the city from the restaurant on the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: eastiseast
Reviews.Content: The selling point with this hotel is the roof terrace. It offers amazing views of the city and I realy enjoyed having my meals there for this reason. It can be enjoyed all year round because it's enclosed. The majority of the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The young men at the desk were excellent. There was only one man I found indifferent but he was the exception. All the restaurant staff were excellent and very helpful. I found the rooms to be extremely clean and the bathroom of a high standard. It's small but modern with an excellent shower. On approaching the hotel I thought it looked a bit tacky from the outside but it was much better than I thought inside. It is on a busy road butit's easy to access all the major sites

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RowleyEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a birthday celebration. We could not have chosen better. The location is very convenient for all the major sights in Istanbul (Although I should mention that the immediately surrounding area is not very picturesque. It is in the middle of more than 100 hardware shops, very handy if you want a spanner or lawnmower. You soon get used to the though). More importantly, it is easy to get anywhere from here, and the view from the rooftop restaurant is stunning. We had breakfast there every morning, and dinner there one evening which was excellent. We were there during a fairly cold and miserable March, but the rooftop is fully enclosed, and breathtaking views complimented the great food. Next time though we will go in warmer weather to experience it with the covering off. Ali and the rest of the team there could not have been more friendly and welcoming. They were very helpful in all respects, and even baked a special cake for my wife's birthday - she was delighted. Thank you to all of you. All in all we were delighted with the Golden City - it is excellent value for money (as is Istanbul generally) and I would thorughly recommend to anyone who doesn't mind walking past a few hardware shops!

Reviews.Title: “Warmth in a freezing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Goose058
Reviews.Content: We visited in February - freezing weather outside but the warmth and genuinely friendly approach of every single staff member we met, including room maids and technicians was outstanding. We stayed 5 nights - in room recommended by other reviewers on high floor corner - and ate in the hotel extensively because of the weather. We came away with a very positive sense of the Hotel and of Istanbul as a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nana100382
Reviews.Content: we Stayed there for 7 days, the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, The view from the roof top restaurant is wonderful, the location is really good 5 min walk from both the tunnel and the tram stations,

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolly98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Everything was very good. The room was comfortable,and very warm-it was snowing and very cold outside-so warmth was much appreciated.The food was good, and dinner was reasonably priced, and you were quite happy to eat in the hotel, and of course fabulous vies. The staff were very helpful, particularly sa youn girl in the restaurant who wen out of her way to advise us on food. The only neative, and this was not the hotel's fault, constant barking of dogs,otherwise excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location, best money/value”
Reviews.Author: Family627
Reviews.Content: My family and me visited Istanbul for siteseeing. The Golden City hotel is perfectly located to access all main sites. The price/value and the quality is very good. And the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely well run Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Stuart S
Reviews.Content: 5 x adults stayed at the Istanbul Golden City Hotel for 2 x nights. Fantastic roof bar with stunning views across the Golden Horn. Nice rooms, fantastically friendly staff, good food and drink. Great communication via e-mail prior to arriving. The Hotel arranged a mini-bus to collect us from the airport. We were all surprised when we paid the bill, at how low the overall cost was. if ever i return to Istanbul, I would stay here again.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ccozens
Reviews.Content: The hotel was refurbished late 2009 which attracted me to stay. It didn't dissapointment, everything is still looking new and fresh. Its important when staying to take a River view room, the others called city view will look over the road which is quite busy. Rooms 801 and 802 are overlooking the river but rather small doubles - ok for a weekend break but if staying longer take room 804 which is a nice corner room used in the advertising and larger. The roof top bar is just as the advertising suggest with views of the city, Galata tower and bridge etc etc... The location is one of the greatest things of this hotel. You can easily walk to the Spice Market, Grand Bazzaar, and also into the centre. I would suggest taking the Tunel Tram into the city. The Tunel is a short 200m walk from the hotel and costs 3lira single, 5 return. the Tunel tram stops quite early, so if having a night out you prefer to take a taxi back. The hotel staff and service was excellent and as well as parking our car, delivering cases to the room etc etc they provided excellent advice of how to spend our short time in the city. Suggesting an evening Bosphorus Cruise which was great. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ssim065
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with an amazing balcony restaurant overlooking the entire city. Ok size room with a fantastic view if you can get a room on a higher level. Nice clean bathroom. Good location to tram. Would definitely stay again if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: choi3js
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for one night on my way back from Cyprus. The hotel is fairly new so everything is super clean. My room wasn't big, but it had a king sized bed, nice bathroom, good tv, and FANTASTIC view of the city. The location is good, although it is basically in the middle of a highway so it's a bit difficult to stop and get cabs and such, but wasn't a huge problem. I didn't have the food but when I missed the included breakfast they were willing to go out of their way to cook it separately for me. Before this I spent a few nights in Istanbul elsewhere, but I would without a doubt come back to Golden City when I am in Istanbul again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Bouff
Reviews.Content: We booked a cruise which sailed from Istanbul and were looking for a Hotel near to the cruise terminal. Using Trip Advisor, as is my usual custom, this proved to be a likely candidate. Having sailed into Istanbul on a previous occasion I was aware of the numerous tool shops in the street where the Hotel is located. I received excellent service from the Hotel from my first point of contact some 9 months before our proposed stay. They arranged our airport transfers as well as transferring us to and from the cruise terminal before and after our cruise. They stored our luggage on our return as we had time to kill before setting off for the airport. When we checked in we were allocated a lovely room on the 9th floor with superb views. The room was a very good size with a lovely bathroom and all was very clean. Unfortunately we did not eat at the rooftop restaurant as in late October we thought it might be a bit cold. I fear that was our loss. Breakfast the next morning in the basement breakfast room was perfectly acceptable with plenty of staff keeping an eye on things. All the staff we had dealings with were most polite and friendly despite the language difficulties (on our part!). All in all an excellent Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “16 friends stayed at the Istanbul Golden City in November”
Reviews.Author: Nadia H
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed our stay. We all had rooms with a beautiful view on the Golden Horn. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast good. We had a nice dinner on the terrace from where we could admire the old city skyline all lit up. It was a cool evening but we kept comfortable with shawls and heaters provided by the hotel. The hotel is conveniently situated. It is a few minutes walk to the "tÃ¼nel", the underground that connects to one of the main streets of modern Istanbul which has many shops and restaurants. It is also a few minutes walk to the "tram" which connects to the old city, its mosques and museums. The only caveat is that the commercial street on which the hotel is situated while busy during the day is deserted at night which might make the 3 minute walk to "tÃ¼nel" and "tram" a bit intimidating for people walking it alone. It is no problem for couples or groups. I would recommend the hotel to all my friends. It is an excellent value and affords a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “R & R from Australia. If you are looking to stay on the asian side”
Reviews.Author: Ros G
Reviews.Content: then this hotel is ideal. Fantastic views across Golden Horn and Galata Bridge and to Galata tower. We loved the roof top restaurant, even on a wet night the wait and bar staff were attentive and really pleased to serve us and made sure we kept warm and dry with blankets! Enjoyed another side of Istanbul away from the European side with all their shops, shops and more shops trying to sell to the tourist. Yes you do walk past lots of trade shops to get to the hotel but enjoyed that part of the city. Upto Galata Tower past the music instrument shops and onto Istiklal Street to Taksim Sq. Back to the hotel we found the rooms comfortable and adequate. All the staff were very helpful, in particular Ali at reception desk went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble, arranged transport to the airport and our baggage looked after following our check out.

Reviews.Title: “stay 4days”
Reviews.Author: fara046
Reviews.Content: the hotel has magnificent view from my room and on the roof .my room was in 8floor but the room for 3 person is so tiny.and I think in this hotel you cannot expect any three bedrooms but for two person is ok.in reception desk Dugu is so nice and helpful but other reception staff don't know english very well.my friend lost her gold neckless in our room and the lady who cleaned our room found it and put it on our table and we appriciate it a lot.we enjoyed our stay a lot except tiny room for 3person.

Reviews.Title: “Best view and services ever”
Reviews.Author: mohamed b
Reviews.Content: i don't know where to start : first we asked the hotel for a pick up at the airport , the passport control took a long time and yet our transportation was waiting and we could easily find him. he took us in a private VW van . very good driver . at the check in it was very simple , he just took passports and we were done in 5 minutes (as soon as we finished our welcome drink), no need for marriage certificate or other, we had recomended to have room in the 6th+ to have a better view , and mr ali (hotel manager ) was preparing a surprise . a room in the 9th floor which had an incredibly gr8 view. prepared with the extra bed. breakfast was served at the roof top restaurant were you have a pnoramic view for the golden horn and the old city , really fabuolus . the food itself was very delicious , yet one kind of bed was served. the eleveators were small and crouded during breakfast, but we didn't have much trouble as we were 1 floor under restaurant. as for preparing trips , you just check which trip you want , and they plan it for you. we asked for transportation to airport and it was waiting 15 minutes earlier than we asked . my experience was wonderful. i would recomend it to everyone. specially it is in a quiet area , when you need to go to crouded places , just take the tunel 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the center of Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Gerdi082
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days in hotel Golden City Istanbul. At first I was looking forward to enjoying the breakfast on the roof, as described in many reviews. I can only confirm the other reviews: it was absolutely stunning. We had one time dinner on the roof top too; dinner was fine, but view on the Bosporus,and highlighted monuments = wow! We had room 901, on the second highest floor; we had a magnificent view on both the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque! Room was spacious, our bathroom was brand new and spotlessly clean. Staff was very friendly at the welcome desk, we even received a welcome drink at check in! We had a late flight our last day we left, but because hotel was fully booked, we could not keep our room a couple of hours longer. But we could leave our baggage without any problem in a room next to reception so we could enjoy our last day in Istanbul. Neighborhood: hotel is 200m from the tram line T1 which connects you to the whole city, as well from there you can crossed the Galata Bridge directly to the Spice Bazaar! Bus stop even at 10m (but we didnt'use this, so can't comment on this connection...) Highlights if first time in Istanbul: Blue mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace Museum, Big Bazaar, Spice Bazaar. For the evenings go to the Galata tower Area (Istikal Caddesi) where you will find lots of great restaurants, bars and warm atmosphere! Restaurant I recomment: Antiochia; small & cosy restaurant with home made food from heaven!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel In A Great Location In A Beautiful City!”
Reviews.Author: lisboa186
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem! A very reasonable price for the quality and service provided. Although the street the hotel is situated in is not what where the typical tourist would expect a hotel of this class to be located, it is, on reflection, a really convenient place to have a base, within the city of Istanbul. This hotel is certainly ideally placed for all of the attractions of the old/ancient city of Istanbul, and indeed, well placed for travel (by water) to all the modern suburbs of the city. All the attractions of the ancient city, are literally a short walk from this hotel. The Galata and Beyoglu districts are a short walk up a (steep) hill from the hotel, and, the main historic attractions are a short walk across one of two nearby bridges, that link this side of the Golden Horn, with that where those attractions are located (namely, the Sultanahmet, etc). The hotel itself, is located along a busy light-industrial street, with a small but attractive and contemporary reception/lobby. The staff are very friendly and attentive, and generally speak a decent level of English. Your luggage is likely to be delivered to your room, on arrival at the hotel (you may wish to offer a 'tip' for this). The most amazing feature of the hotel, is the rooftop terrace/restaurant and bar. When we holidayed in this hotel (June 2011), nine of the ten breakfasts (decent choice of food), were served on this rooftop facility. The most amazing panoramic views of the ancient city can be seen from up there! The room we had was fairly spacious, but above all, very clean and serviced with air-conditioning. An all-round, very good experience, in a beautiful and exciting city!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for a Romantic and Interesting City Trip to Istanbul & more ...!!”
Reviews.Author: MMinIstanbul
Reviews.Content: For our wedding in Istanbul we were trying to find a place to accommodate our guests from around the world - easy to reach from the airport, still in the city centre to reach the main spots to show them this beautiful city even by a short walk, large enough rooms to make them feel comfortable and dress up, not too expensive to scare them off, nice surrounding and a perfect view ... all this together AND for a reasonable price is usually impossible ... but we were searching and searching and found this perfect place - including warm, friendly and caring staff - just perfect - I cannot recommend it more ... plus ... you cannot beat this view ... and it's every morning for breakfast, every evening for maybe having dinner up there or whenever you want to enjoy a perfect view over Istanbul. As we were staying there as well for a few extra days I can also recommend checking out their own restaurant on the rooftop ... really good food for a reasonable price. Clean rooms and satisfactory alternating breakfast - if you want to reach the main spots e.g. in Sultanahmet like the Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar or the Blue Mosk it is just a 2 minute walk to the Tram Station where you drive 1 respectively 3 stations for only 2TL.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: rottydog0001
Reviews.Content: the area was real bad hated it but the staff was friendly , the breakfast well same every day no change not that great . the rooms are small but u are close to things . love the roof staff the best at night . it was clean . beware of taxies . i might stay again. net speed bad had to have room change but it was ok like 2nd room better. staff very good but their english was bad .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect, Helpful staff, Amazing view, clean simply room”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: Firstly I dont usually write reviews, but I believe this hotel was perfect and offered everything I could ask for. My partner lost her watch in Istanbul Airport on the way home and the staff at the hotel actually helped me retrieve the watch and send it back to the UK, they were very helpful and kind and i was impressed by everything they done for us. I think this shows thier dedication to thier customers. They were much more helpful than fedex and the travel insurance people put together. I would 100% reccomend this hotel, it was the perfect hotel for a weekend trip and or business meeting, the roof garden/bar is perfect for breakfast or late night drink before bed and you can see a great view of the city. The rooms are clean and tidy and yourcant ask for much more...... Again this hotel I would reccomend to everyone, business and pleaseure customers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and we recommend it”
Reviews.Author: cabdul
Reviews.Content: We stayed there end of July and beginning of August for two weeks. We were a big family. I read some reviews here which some of them scared me a little bit while some gave a true picture about the location. According to our experience it went well and the staff were very well and happy, asking always when ever you go out or coming back to the hotel if there anything they can do for you or if everything is OK. especially Mr Ali was very helpful. If going back there I would stay there again, It is close to Galata Bridge where there is a lot of restaurants under the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, location unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: highbury19
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very disappointing, not a boutique hotel at all. It provided the basic amenities but nothing more. The location is also poor. Although it is not far from some major sights, the immediate neighbourhood has no cafes or other amenities, is a dirty and noisy district of plumbing and small equipment shops â€“ it was difficult to walk around as you had to pick your way through toilet pans, sinks, cisterns tap displays etc. that were displayed in every square meter of pavement. The roof top restaurant was lovely with great views but, contrary to advertising, was not used for breakfast which you had to have in a dark and unpleasant basement room. The food was not good either for breakfast or in the restaurant so rooftop useful only for an early evening drink. Finally, while most of the staff were pleasant and helpful, the man on reception was borderline rude, constantly taking phone calls while people were waiting to check in or check out or get information. I also noticed that he was particularly unhelpful to the women guests who were travelling on their own. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful birthdaytrip”
Reviews.Author: Franz072
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in the ISTANBUL in the Golden City Hotel. Located in the city, easy access from the ATATURK airport - Metro and tramway. Tram and ferryboat station nearby - ca 400 meters. The best thing at this place is the roof top restaurant for breakfast and dinner. Great view over the histoical city of Istanbul. Personell very friendly and helpful. Great place to stay and to enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: TrAvel2403
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is in the heart of the industrial market of Istanbul, but that should not deter you from staying here for business or leisure. The location is ideal for tourists too because of its proximity to the peninsua, golden horn and beyoglu. Everything is within walking distance. Excellent connectivity by bus or the tram. The metro is not far off either. I would recommend that one takes rooms ont he higher levels because they then offer excellent views of the golden horn. Breakfast is not that great but their roof top restaurant serves excellent seafood. Service is prompt and the staff is very courteous. Other than the people int he reception, nobody knows English. I'll definitely be staying here the next time too.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, amazing roof deck, helpful and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: viajar-fotografar
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived to Golden City Hotel only to realize we had incorrectly made our reservation for one week later. They were nearly full but Ali and the reservation manager Nergiz were very helpful and able to find us a room and shift our reservation. The rooms were very quiet at night, and the view of sunrise from the roof deck at breakfast was amazing. There's not much around the hotel, but it's only about 10 mins walk to the bridge over to the old city, and about the same up to Galata tower, and the beginning of lively Istikal street. The streets and alleys coming down from Galata are a little dark at night but we never felt unsafe walking home. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmmanBashar
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel very much, its simple but in the same time its comfortable; the deluxe room have a very nice sea view; when the breakfast be on the roof you will enjoy a very nice view for the amazing Istanbul mosques; what i didn't like that the hotel is a way from the metro station, but you can easily take a taxi to Taksim square with 6 TL.

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ivebeenhere11
Reviews.Content: New Hotel, very clean, very friendly and helpful staff, great view from the terrace on the roof (restaurant). The hotel could do with soundproof windows, and the service (or kitchen) of the restaurant could have been quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, amazing View, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hell0Kitty7
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is totally new. The location is very good. You can reach all Sites by Foot. It has a rooftop Restaurant with an amazing view over istanbul. The rooms have an Amazone View too. Towards the Golden Horn and the Hot Spots of istanbul. The Staff is super friendly. It was the birthday of my Hutband and the Staff prepared a surprise and a birthday cake, Served on the rooftop with candles etc. It was an outstanding stay!!! Thank you very much!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best city and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuncay245
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not wonderful, it was ok. The only problem is the elevators, it should be wide. The terrace was wonderful. What can I say about Istanbul? I love this city and just one advise - please take a boat and sail to Asia side (Uskudar, etc), and feel not crowded and real Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “â€œPerfect Hotel... the view was truely amazing!!!â€�”
Reviews.Author: Guita40
Reviews.Content: We loved Golden City Hotel ... the view was something more than breathtaking!! Golden City hotel is truely amazing... it is modern... it's all about personalized accommodation and services...PERFECT and modern rooms, friendly and helpful staff, fantastic location, tastey food, amazing view from the roof top terrace, free Internet in the rooms, ... we could not ask for more!!! We were so lucky to find this hotel!! Defenetely reccomend it and I am sure we will go back again to this hotel. (Adam & Guita from Canada)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Heathcliff_83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. The personnel is very friendly and helpful, eager to answer to any question at any time. The rooms are very clean and cozy. The bathroom is also clean, there is a spacious shower with a built-in glass door. The view from the rooms is fantastic, the Golden Horn lies in front of you, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, SÃ¼leymaniye Camii and the bridges create a spectacular view, especially at night. The rooms on the 9th floor are named after the sight to which they provide optimal view, for example Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Golden Horn, etc. We stayed in 904 Hagia Sophia and the view was unforgettable. The price of the rooms is in my opinion reasonable, considering what they offer. The restaurant on the 10th floor terrace is a great place to relax at night after a long sightseeing day having dinner or just a drink with a panoramic view of the Golden Horn. There are heaters and the staff brings you blankets to cover yourself in case you feel cold. The food is quite nice and you can pay in the end of your stay at the reception. Even if you choose not to stay in this hotel, the restaurant is still a nice place to visit and take some memorable photos! Also there is a very funny (in a good way of course) guy working there, Fatih, who can make your evening even more pleasant with his humour! By the way, the bar on the ground floor, next to the reception, was quite expensive, for example a bottle of water was even more expensive than the one of the room's mini bar! The hotel is conveniently located very close (500 meters) to a tram stop (KarakÃ¶y). This is very helpful, as tram (and not metro) is the main means of transportation in the city that takes you to most of the interesting places (Sultanahmet square with Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museum, KapalÄ± Ã‡arÅŸÄ±, Egyptian Market, all places one must definetely visit). It's a short, straight walk so even if you are carrying luggage it is easy to do it, you just have to pass in front of some small shops on a sometimes narrow pavement. The Galata Tower is a short (400 m) but uphill walk from the hotel, the view from the top of the tower however is rewarding! If you want to reach Taksim Square, you have to take the tram all the way to the last stop (KabataÅŸ) and then pay an extra ticket to get on the funicular for just one stop. Once you are there, you can walk all the way down Ä°stiklÃ¢l Cad and from its end, the hotel is just an easy downhill walk. If you want to go to the airport (or the International Bus Terminal) you have to use tram and metro. If you are carrying luggage prefer to take the tram all the way and change at Zeytinburnu instead of changing at YusufpaÅŸa where you have to walk up and down the stairs 3 times (there are no rolling ladders!) and walk a significant distance. Public transportation is definetely a much cheaper way of reaching the airport, rather than taxi, but allow yourself enough time (about 2 h), as the tram might move slowly downtown during rush hour. The hotel receptionists, although eager to help, don't seem to know much about public transportation so prefer using a map instead of asking them. Generally, I would say that Istanbul Golden City Hotel is a great option for someone to stay and explore the city, combining both nice services and spectacular view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZA111111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent located in Beyagulu area. The views are amazing. Ask for rooms such as 903, 803, 703 etc becyuase the have excellent views of Sultanate area, the Aya Sofia, Topkai Palace and mosques of Istanbul and river. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The price of room was such that I got more than what I paid for. The rooms were clean The hotel conserves electricity, in that lights of passages go off there is no movement. The restaurant at the top of the hotel has excellent views and delicious chocolate eccl airs. The main nightlife is 10 minutes walk away in Beyagulu Area. I think the roads name is Iskandilis ?? , but you can ask reception. The hotel is near the tram services that take you to old Istanbul ior you can walk to Old Istanbul over the bridge to Aya Sofia....about 15 minutes. Overall, best hotel you can stay in. And will beat many of hotels operated by international chain hotels. Breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “OK with buts”
Reviews.Author: 1Maku1
Reviews.Content: The best part here is definitely the staff - friendly and helpful, just great. They made us feel like celebrities right when we entered the hotel. Thanks for that. The rooftop terrace is also great (like was the view from our smallish deluxe room). Unfortunately breakfast was not served there. Some sun chairs would make the terrace even more attractive & useful during daytime. Breakfast was pretty poor, but acceptable. The biggest problem was the location. It's been thanked here, but probably because of the view. But the hotel is located between the bay and a large street with no restaurants very close. In the night it was a rather uncomfortable walk in dark&quiet street (and in most cases uphill) to the restaurants. We ended up taking taxies quite often, which can also be a problem as the drivers don't like short rides and tend to cheat... I warmly recommend taking airport taxi through the hotel - best way to skip cheating. Worked well on our way back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bullit3
Reviews.Content: We was very happy with the service personal. It was a nice stay there..

Reviews.Title: “Ugly, charcterless block in bad location.”
Reviews.Author: CCastleWestMalling
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is an eyesore from every direction. From accross the Galata Bridge in Sultanameh it stands out - a horrid yellow block illuminated with red and blue neon. It is located in a busy , noisy street which is inbetween the main areas you want to visit , the Old City or Beylogu - so you will have a fair way to walk though a tatty area before you reach anywhere you want to be. Once inside you could be in any City in any Country, there is not one thing to tell you you are in Instanbul, one of the Worlds most exciting and stylish cities. There is no nice bar, no lounge area, the rooms on the upper floor have some good views, but it is a collection of boring,over-priced, over-heated bedrooms with an expensive ugly restaurant on the top. On previous trip to Istanbul we stayed at Empress Zoe - a lovely unique and very special hotel, how we missed it !

Reviews.Title: “A convenient hotel which is not overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AlanXM
Reviews.Content: I was with a group and stayed on afterwards solo. Free Internet was available and there were dramatic views of the Golden Horn with ferries scurrying for berths, from the 10th floor bar. This is best in the afternoons when the western sun illuminates the view of the Gallata Bridge. The restaurant was congested when my group of 35 was there. Maybe a larger room is needed. My next visit to this hotel will be when the TCDD rail link has been connected under the Bospherous.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but wrong location”
Reviews.Author: argyris23
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 4 nights but finally we stayed only 1. The hotel was ok in general but the location is awfull. It is on a busy street having stores with tools all around. The view from our room was to the road and from the side window we stared at an abadoned old building. We didn't have the chance to have dinner at the roof top restaurant but from the fotos looks nice. For my personal opinion I counldn't easily recommend someone to stay there, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “The best 4* hotel in the heart of Istanbul, whatever we could imagine..”
Reviews.Author: KadikoyBudapest
Reviews.Content: Dear Travellers, Genuinely recommended hotel for all those people, whom are preferring to be accomodated in a hotel, which is quite closed to the centre of Istanbul, inspite of that have to walk through on the famous Galata-bridge, if you would like to pass on it.. But don't worry, not so tiring..particularly if you can enjoy the vision of the anglers..:) So funny, not even mentioned those thousands of restaurant are all there.. ..and the fish-market, which is also amazing, we were passing there all the time, finally 3 times we have eaten there, from 5 TL ( "Hamsi" with ruccola salad & sweet onion) - 80 TL dinner in one of our favourite place.. The tram is also very close, and very cheap..by the way let me mention about those boat-transfers, transporting the locals and the tourists from place to place, for example ÃœSTÃœKKAR-KADIKÃ–Y-KARAKÃ–Y-EMINÃ–NÃœ..(closed to the Golden City Hotel , on the other side..( also cheap, 1,75 TL ) On the 10th floor, from the roof terrace all Istanbul is lying before You.. Such a pretty view !!! (Advice about transfers: you don't need to book before, because at the Sabiha GÃ¶kcen Airport , after arrival you will find immeadiately a company drop you to your hotel for 15 euro..and our way back we booked by someone else, airportshuttle.com/istanbul was cost 10 euro/person.. ) Summary: If we would return to Istanbul ('ll), we would choose again this hotel, for sure, so have a nice pleasant there, enjoy the room, the view from the roof, and the abundant and wide choices of your breakfast! Brgds for all, Thanks a lot the kindness for all the stuff Hungarian young couple from Budapest

Reviews.Title: “the cost is too high”
Reviews.Author: EvgeniyPen
Reviews.Content: Good view of the rooms only ** 1 -** 4 above 6 floors; upon departure tried to take undue additional cost; very noisy in the room of the cars on the street

Reviews.Title: “awesome view on the golden horn”
Reviews.Author: Hamdam_Ezzati
Reviews.Content: I booked my last night in my Istanbul trip in "Istanbul Golden City hotel" for a city view room and the gave me sea view room as i asked for twin bed, 5 stars service, 5 min walk to KarakÃ¶y tram station, 2 min to the golden horn shore where you can set and have an awesome view with local cafe serving Turkish tea and some sandwiches. You also can walk to Spice Bazaar and EminÃ¶nÃ¼ ferry docks ....the roof rest. Have an amazing view with delicious dishesâ€™ with reasonable prices.... The only negatives points is the hotel is surrounded by hard ware shops and in the night you can hear street dogs barking and some noises.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and nice rooms in the Center of the City”
Reviews.Author: kmnuremberg
Reviews.Content: Very helpful hotel-team, nice rooms, fantastic view from the roof-deck. Near to the Galata bridge in the middle between the old and new City. Short ways to the public traffic; but if a shoeshine-boy looses his brush don't help, avoid the contact.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous and great expirence to stay in Istanbul Goldencity Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sajjad11111
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent hotel in istanbul,every thing is 100% perfect and satisfactory especially front desk manager Mr.Ali is really very kind and helpful to us he gave us very good corner room and helpout to go by metro.I will suggest every one must go goldencity for having great trip.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: eliton
Reviews.Content: Best choice for those people who like cozy hotels near the sightseeings and also want to get to shopping plases fast

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip... Great Service & Staff was Brill!!! A****”
Reviews.Author: tajkhan
Reviews.Content: We had great time at the hotel, staff was brill and location was close to all the attractions... i must say that the service was A* and i would reccomend this to friends and family... and i will also stay here again. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Preferable hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: QHR
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a warm ambiance, nice view and a good location. Hotel is well decorated and clean. Staff must be trained much more. I have stayed in a deluxe room but it was even smaller than a standard room. There is a roof restaurant with a great view unfortunately i didn't tested because of bad weather conditions. A portable roof system can solve this problem easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: S_Deva25
Reviews.Content: Its a lovely modern boutique hotel. The staff is very friendly, especially the guy named Serkan Kaftanoglu, who is at reception, very lovely, friendly and helpful! ; )

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kneipmeister
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a perfect location: in between the old city and the modern part of the city with a great view on the river and the mosques. Rooms are not big but big enough with everything you need. Especially a very nice shower. Rooms are cleaned everyday. Breakfast is very good. There is a lot of choice and the food is tastful. The staf is very friendly and helpful. You can ask them everything and they take care of it immediately. They all speak Enlish very well. The rooms are averagely priced: 70 euro per night ( incl. Breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Decent Base to Explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lclarkhfc
Reviews.Content: In short, a new, clean and well run hotel. No problems to report at all, friendly staff, decent breakfast and excellent panoramic views over the Bopsphorous from our 6th floor room. I see other reviewers have commented on the location. Yes, it is in a seemingly out of the way street (in what must be the street to come to if you are a DIY enthusiast!) but do not be fooled! We felt perfectly safe and the location was ideal for exploring the 'new' part of town around the Galata (?) Tower district on the hotel side of the river and the 'old' town across the bridge (15mins walk). I'm sure Istanbul is a lot larger than this in total but for our short break these areas gave us more than enough to do. We found the immediate area outside the hotel came to life during the day with the vibrant DIY shops / markets in close proximity to the fish market, anglers and restaurants that line the bridge. We had a great trip and the hotel was good value and ideally located (and we have stayed in some dodgy hotels in the past!) so thumbs up to the Golden City.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Wildy29
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant time at this hotel although due to it's location it wasn't great. It's in a run down area of Istanbul which is a bit scary at night walking home. Great views from the rooftop restaurant. Rooms are ok but don't expect too much. Service though was 5star! I would recommend if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “unforgetable trip”
Reviews.Author: wangrui294212
Reviews.Content: My Istanbul trip was unforgettable, thanks to Istanbul Golden City Hotel and its staff. My reservation, arrival and stay were very well organized. Upon check in they offered a welcome cocktail and I was accompanied to the room by a corteous manager, who was very professional and informative. My room was just as I saw on the pictures: size, amenities and wonderfull view! So no cheating and overestimating. The location was very central too: in 10 minutes you can get either to new city or old city. In short everything is just as I wanted!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: m-r-y-c
Reviews.Content: This is our first time stay at Istanbul Golden City Hotel in February 2011, booked thru the internet Tripadvisor / Booking.com - We share our experience and strongly recommend the hotel for all type of travelers / visitors to Istanbul. The hotel is excellent by all means not only the price as value for money, but also everything else including the location, view, room, bathroom, general appearance and cleanliness, services, F & B at breakfast and other meals, and among all everyone of the staff. Special thanks and appreciation to Mr. Ali front office manager he is great and very helpful, as well as the wonderful and courteous Ms. Nergis. Indeed will choose this hotel for our stay in all future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, I like there ....”
Reviews.Author: NikolayStepanovich
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location was perfect. Breathtaking view over sea from my room and roof restaurant. Breakfast was sufficient and had a lot of choise. Nice, friendly staff, always willing to help. Will come back in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Too dark surroundings at night. But OK.”
Reviews.Author: R-eyesplice
Reviews.Content: Room was OK. I had imagined a better hotel from the opinions I had read at Traveladvisor, though, so I was a bit disappointed. I had been in Istambul before, in a hotel near Taksim square, and I will go back there next time. - Someone mentioned that breakfast was at the penthouse... Not when I visited. Breakfast was in a basement, with views to the tires of the cars parked around the hotel. - The views from the rooms are mainly to the building in front, except for the very high floors. There is a bit of side view, that's true, but about 15% of the window space in total. - While it's true that it's close to the bridge where there are many restaurants, the walk from the bridge to the hotel is quite dark at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic....!!”
Reviews.Author: haticecik
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic..! The view was very beautiful. The location of the hotel was very central. The important places are very nearby. The staff were very friendly. The rooms and the hotel were very clean and comfertable. The breakfast and lunch was delicious. I do not know how to tell it. It was just super..!! My partner and i stayed there seven days we did not leave:(( We will book again..! If you are looking for a hotel in Istanbul, not think just do it and go to golden city istanbul.....!!!! ;))

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler_1997
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. Rooms had a great view. I say rooms because we were even able to change one to another (Ali helped us) and see the other side of the city. Food for breakfast was also great - big variety of things every day. It was easy to get to all the places we wanted ( by walking or using the tram which is about 10 minutes away ) although at night it could seem dangerous a bit because no people on the street but it wasn't a problem. At day time there was a great possibility to buy useful things for home because all of the hardware shops on the street...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for holidays and business”
Reviews.Author: mvh49
Reviews.Content: Great hotel where everything is working well. The staff is excellent. Everyone in reception as well as in restaurant, shuttle drivers etc. are so spontaneously friendly and make everything so easy to the traveler. Wonderful view from the room to Suleiman mosque and Golden Horn. P.S. take an empty bag with you to renew your tool sets - too many interesting hardware shops around the hotel, the whole quarter is a big home depot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: relaxation-hound
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the staff was also good. The location is a negative as it is in a more industrial area so at night the choices for food, and people on the street is zero. In the day it was fine a short scenic wal accross the Gallata Bridge to Emenou and Sultanhamet.

HotelInfo.Name: Istanbul Golden City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Tersane Caddesi No:111, Galata, Beyoglu, Istanbul 34440, Turkey
